transcript: their doubts and excite their imagination, giving them a bent for exaggeration quite contrary to Christian sim- plicity. Let us rather read the Epistles and Gospels. Let us not seek to penetrate what mysteries they contain; for how can we, miserable sinners that we are, know the terrible and holy secrets of Provi- dence while we remain in this flesh which forms an impenetrable veil between us and the Eternal?
